context/0: I saw one of them on the beach.

context/2: I kind of got used to being a commander so when I arrived here at the hospital I took a look at the enlisted men's ward and then the officer's ward and I said to myself, "Let's let it ride along for a while."
context/3: Yes, there's always the unexpected, isn't there?
context/4: But at Saito's camp, the officers worked along with the rest.
context/6: I thought officers would get better treatment.
context/7: So you changed uniforms with a dead man.
context/8: I figured it was just a matter of time before I was captured

context: But I don't mean no harm.
response: I'm just trying to be a little friendly.
context/0: That's what everybody tells me.
context/1: I know I talk too much.
context/3: I wish you'd get on with your work.
context/4: Please.
context/5: How much you pay for a spread like this?
context/6: You take those drapes, take this furniture, take that bedspread.
context/7: I can tell you got good taste.
context/8: You take this room for instance.
context/9: You'd be surprised at some of the things I see.

context: Tell me you wouldn't have killed them.
context/0: Lie to me Baby.
context/1: I know.
context/2: A couple of kids up there.
context/3: If you're so worried about Mom, go on home.
context/4: Ma'll skin up if we're late for supper.
context/5: We ought to be getting home.
context/7: Who wants an old crow anyway?
context/8: Look at those feathers flying around.

context: so they know, as long as I´m alive, that this house will attend all honor calls.
response: How long will we continue like this?
context/0: Lock them up...or better yet... let them come down, that way they´ll see that there are brave men.
context/1: Don´t you ever think about them?
context/4: Dueling is forbidden
context/6: I don´t know what´s so shocking to you
context/7: We have always held duels in this house.
context/8: I will never allow it in my house!
context/9: It´s Pablo Aguirre, the man who came last night and danced with Ana white as marble, he already had dead in his gaze.

response: You're still aiming to hold me?
context/0: Here.
context/1: Don't go to sleep cos they'll be back.
context/2: They were after guns and ammunition.
context/4: Better hold him.
context/7: Only if it's a Northern soldier trying to sneak into Texas as a spy.
context/8: Do you ask everyone the same thing?

context: I'm pointing it at a no-good Yankee.
response: Shouldn't we forget about the war?
context/0: Careful where you point that gun.
context/1: Now, mister.
context/2: I made that up to make her go.
context/4: I'll be there in a minute.
context/7: Stella!
context/9: It let all my feelings loose.

response: This is a Bayonne, New Jersey calling Langham Field.
context/0: We're diving on the first one.
context/1: Only one thing left, drop on them plane and all.
context/4: The giant arm raised, green flash, they're spraying us with flame.
context/5: 1,000 yards and we'll be over the first, 800 yards, 600, 400, 200, there they go.
context/7: The switchboard operator's are about ready to go out of their minds.

context/0: I'd like to talk to Mrs. Edward Davenport, please.
context/1: This is Dr. Frank Renault.
context/4: I'm sick.
context/5: Well, get him over here right away.
context/7: Dr. Renault.
context/8: Who's the nearest doc around here?
context/9: This is Mr. Davenport in Cabin 6.

context: Made me feel as though we've been blind.
response: It's been staring us in the face.
context/0: Came to me all of a sudden, just a little while ago.
context/1: Yes.
context/3: I've been thinking about it and an idea came to me just now.
context/4: Oh, I don't know.
context/5: I doubt if they ever will.
context/7: Well, seen anything of the murderer?
